Well, I ordered asparagus ($13) got 5 spears not what I would call a "sharing" quantity. For dessert the waiter suggested the toffee pudding - I would not recommend it. Service - okay but nothing special. Overall, not worth the $$$
Probably the best Cowboy Ribeye I've ever had in Vegas!

I had a lovely dinner here with the hubby, make sure you guys make a reservation because we didn't and we ended up waiting about 35 minutes for a table. 

Once seated in had alerted the server that we are in a slight time crunch because we were going to go see kaskade after dinner. And he was understanding and got right to our order so we can leave on time. We got crab cakes for an appetizer to start and my hubby got the dry aged steak (and with bernaise sauce) with an Australian lobster tail, and I got the rack of roasted lamb and we were going to share a side of mash potatoes. 

The food was cooked perfectly, my lamb was extremely tender and practically falling off the bone, and my hubby loved his meal as well the only down side for him was he asked if he could get the main lobster tail instead of the Australian lobster tail but they couldn't do that. And personally we just prefer the Maine lobster because it's sweeter and more succulent. You must get the bernaise sauce if you get the steak, it takes the steak to a completely different level, it makes it so much better. The crab cakes was great and so was the mash potatoes. 

Our dinner was very delicious and we'll definitely be back the next time we're in vegas.

We weren't planning on eating at a steakhouse while in Las Vegas, but when we saw their display of dry aged slabs of steaks, our eyes were set. It was a spontaneous decision to eat there and we were not disappointed. There was no wait. We got seated by he kitchen so we had a great view of all the meats on being grilled. Well, all of us of course ordered steak. They only had one type of meat that they aged, and that is the New York strip. It would have been better if they had other selections that they dry aged. The steak was delicious. The waiter's recommendation of getting it medium cooked is perfect. The meat was juicy, tender and flavorful. We also ordered a couple sides. Their mashed potatoes with asiago chedder was their side of the day and it was super yummy. The staff was overall nice and very attentive. They even let one of our friends take a picture of the kitchen area. The price is fair for what they serve. Expect to spend over $100 for two. Maybe more if you order alcoholic drinks with your meal. To those who love steak and is in the Las Vegas New York New York Hotel & Casino, I recommend you try this place and their dry aged steak cooked medium. Bon Appétit!

Tasty, tasty steak!

We wanted to have steak before leaving Vegas. Looking at our options, Gallagher's seems to offer the best value for quality. Made a reservation to make sure we got in on time, as we had a show to catch. Definitely the way to go, since we saw a group turned away just before we got seated.

Had:
Aged Top Sirloin - the aging sure did enhance the flavors of this steak. The beef is the highlight here. They don't try to cover it up.
Cowboy Rib Eye - Big, tender and juicy slab of beef. 
Both were perfectly cooked to order. We didn't eat any steak for a few weeks following this meal because we didn't want to follow up such good steak with something worse.

We also ordered the steak fries. These were great as well. Crunchy on the outside, hot, soft potato on the inside. The ketchup, omg the ketchup! Delicious ketchup with a kick. Our guess is that it's infused with truffle oil and possibly some roasted jalapeno as well. Whatever it is, it lifted the fries beyond 'just another basket of fries'.

Our waiter was attentive throughout. 

We found out that there was an emergency in the kitchen (saw paramedics coming in), yet the only tell-tale sign was that our food took a little longer to come out. They  run a smooth operation.

We have no regrets picking Gallagher's over the other, more upscale steakhouses. The steak is definitely worth the price here, especially when you take into account the Strip premium.

First off just do yourself a favor and order the house special in house dry aged NY.  It's the best piece of meat on the menu as it's the only cut that is dry aged.  

Made a late reservation after seeing Barry Manilow at the Paris.. which by the way was a much better show than I expected.  Upon arriving my co-worker and I were promptly seated at a small table somewhere in the back of the restaurant.  We both ordered the house cut NY steak with asparagus and steak fries.  

Got bread and drinks and then out came the steaks.  Wow.. what a great piece of meat.  I'm definitely a fan of dry aged beef and this steak did not disappoint.  My co-workers steak came out a little overcooked and she was gonna eat it but I made them send it back.  The waiter was really great about it and he came back with a new steak like 3 minutes later.. ok so he stole it from another guys order but who cares right?  This steak was done just right and my co-worker was really glad I made them do that.  

The sides of asparagus and steak fries were good, nothing to writehome about just average.  

Their dessert menus are this weird backlit tablet thingy that's kinda hard on the eyes but nevertheless was kinda cool.  Honestly my steak was so good, I can't even remember what we got for dessert.  

Overall the place could use a good scrubbing and maybe a face lift, but honestly I couldn't care less as long as they keep their prices decent and keep serving up delicious reasonable priced beef.

4 Stars!!  (I'd give it 4.5 if I could)

Dined there on a Saturday night.  It was crowded but I was able to make a reservation about an hour and a half prior to arriving which can be tough sometimes in Vegas.  The meal was great.  Had the Ribeye and the group shared sides.  The steak was cooked perfectly.  The service was on-par with a top notch steakhouse.  The decor needs a little improvement but you do get that steakhouse feel.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to my friends and would visit again.

This place is a must when in Vegas ! 
I wanted a great steak and I found one ! You can't eat here if your on a budget . I had the cowboy ribeye steak ! Wait staff was awesome , very professional and friendly . Can't wait to come back and eat here again !

Very good food, great service.

Queen cut prime rib-Huge portion, very yummy, Ordered medium rare, but got medium to medium well instead =(

Garlic Mashed potatoes SUPER yummy

Mac and Cheese was gross.

Best steak I EVER HAD and i've reviewed a few steak places in the past! I little pricey but what do you expect being on the strip in Vegas! The service was good up until I wanted to pay the bill... I felt as if thwy wanted us to stay to buy more... Dont get me wrong, normally that's great but we ha to catch a show so were on a time limit! I loved it though!

Wow, the food was so underwhelming, for ANY price.  I ordered well done and my meat was still quite pink and very fatty.  I reserved here due to the extremely high yelp ratings and was very disappointed.  However, loved the atmosphere and the service was top notch.  My dining partner also had a fatty, tough steak. With all the great restaurants in Vegas, wish I would have chosen a different steak house.

Top notch place. Came with a group of 6 and had an amazing dinner. Everyone was happy with what they ordered, which included 4 cowboy ribeyes. The sides were delicious and the steaks were prepared perfectly. The service was great, I don't think I ever went empty on water or drinks. I would certainly return again, the steak was incredible.

The ambiance at Gallagher's is simply fantastic.  The staff was very polite and sincere, but also was very educated on the menu.   

The steaks themselves are awesome, ranging from many different cuts to bone-end, etc.

Insanely delicious!  We have dined here a
dozen times and it is always amazing. Friends have recommended ( and we've tried) other steakhouses and they always fall short. The service is impeccable and the steak is perfect. Looking forward to our next meal!

5 stars - because it was the best steak I've ever had, and better be because it was pricey, but worth it. I had the Cowboy Rib-eye medium rare and it was sooo damn good, melted like butter in my mouth. 

4 stars - for the service, I found the waiter kind of cocky and insincere,  however this could be my own personnel preference. 

3 stars - for ambiance and decor, the restaurant was pretty cramped, I felt like I was sharing a table with the other patrons next to us.

Overall, still the best steak I ever had.
